review: This thing is unreliable. It has only ever completed a stream once. It simply loses connection randomly 99% the rest of the time. I decided to relegate it to a music streaming device then, connected to my receiver. It can't even handle that. After a few hours connected, the thing just crashes and needs a reboot. Defeats my goals of effortless streaming. I hooked up a raspberry pi to pull the same duty and it has never crashed in the year or so it's been back there. Roku is also much more reliable. This thing sits unused. I never successfully used it continuously to start with. At least I can reuse the 5v USB charger.

review: I haven't compared Chromecast to any of the other streaming sticks/boxes so I don't know how they compare (probably the same or very similar) but if you do not have one of these it is well worth the investment.
